thread.title: UConn, State NFL Players Through Week 5 Of Season
thread.title_full: UConn, State NFL Players Through Week 5 Of Season - Hartford Courant

author: courant.com
title: UConn, State NFL Players Through Week 5 Of Season
text:
Caption Jordan Todman Lenny Ignelzi / Associated Press Pittsburgh Steelers running back DeAngelo Williams and Jordan Todman talk during warmups before the San Diego Chargers play the Pittsburgh Steelers in an NFL football game Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in San Diego. 
Pittsburgh Steelers running back DeAngelo Williams and Jordan Todman talk during warmups before the San Diego Chargers play the Pittsburgh Steelers in an NFL football game Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in San Diego. 
(Lenny Ignelzi / Associated Press)   Anthony Sherman Peter Aiken / Getty Images Demontre Hurst #30 of the Chicago Bears tackles Anthony Sherman #42 of the Kansas City Chiefs after he recovered a blocked field goal attempt at Arrowhead Stadium during the game on October 11, 2015 in Kansas City, Missouri.  
Demontre Hurst #30 of the Chicago Bears tackles Anthony Sherman #42 of the Kansas City Chiefs after he recovered a blocked field goal attempt at Arrowhead Stadium during the game on October 11, 2015 in Kansas City, Missouri.  
(Peter Aiken / Getty Images) See more galleries Twenty-one players with UConn and state connections remained on NFL rosters as the season passed Week 5. Here is a collection of pictures of several who saw action over last weekend. Looking for a star? How about UConn’s Geremy Davis, who kept a Giants’ drive alive with a 16-yard catch on third down that led to a field goal against the 49ers. The list is now at 21 headed into Week 6 as the Chargers released Donald Brown, the former UConn running back and first-round pick of the Colts.
Here’s a look at how all the CT Connections did:
Chris Baker, Windsor, Redskins LDE: Elevated to starting left end, through five games he has 15 tackles, team-leading 3.5 sacks and two forced fumbles.
Tyvon Branch, UConn, Chiefs, SS: Listed as No. 2 at the position, has seen action in all five games. He had three tackles and two passes defensed in a loss to the Bears in Week 5.
Darius Butler, UConn, Colts RCB: Listed as second string he has played in four of five games – with one start – and has 18 tackles and has forced two fumbles.
Jerome Cunningham, SCSU, Giants TE: Listed as No. 2 on depth chart, he has played in one game this season with a single catch for 3 yards. He has been inactive the last three games with a knee injury
Geremy Davis, UConn, Giants WR: Rookie third-stringer got back on the stat sheet in the Sunday night win over the 49ers with a huge fourth-quarter catch on third down that went for 16 yards.
Marcus Easley, UConn, Bills, WR: Listed as third string but remains the mainstay on special teams, appearing in all five games with three tackles.
Dwayne Gratz, UConn, Jaguars, CB: First corner off the bench, has been limited to three games because of an ankle injury and has six tackles.
Ryan Griffin, UConn, Texans, TE: On injured reserve with designation to return after spraining MCL in opening week vs. Chiefs.
Byron Jones, UConn, Cowboys LCB: In five games has 16 tackles and one pass defensed. Had five tackles while primarily covering Rob Gronkowski in loss to Patriots.
Terrance Knighton, Windsor, Redskins, NT: Starting nose tackle has 11 tackles through five games.
Danny Lansanah, UConn, Buccaneers LB: In five games – four starts – he has 22 tackles, including nine in a win over the Jaguars on Sunday.
Sio Moore, UConn, Colts ILB: Second stringer. Has come off the bench in all five games and has five tackles.
Dan Orlovsky, UConn, Lions, QB: Replaced struggling starter Matthew Stafford midway in third quarter in loss to Cardinals in Sunday and was 21-of-38 for 191 yards a TD and an interception.
Jordan Reed, New London, Redskins TE: Got off to a strong start and had 24 catches (No. 2 on the team) for 278 yards and a TD before he injured his knee and suffered a concussion. He missed Week 5 and is doubtful for this week vs. the Jets.
Kendall Reyes, UConn, Chargers DE. A starter, has 14 tackles this season, including two in Monday night loss to Steelers
Anthony Sherman, UConn, Chiefs, FB: Listed as the starting fullback, his true value comes in blocking and special teams play. He recovered a blocked kick vs. the Bears on Sunday.
Shamar Stephen, UConn, Vikings, NT: In four games as the backup nose tackle has three tackles and a fumble recovery.
Jordan Todman, UConn, Steelers, RB: In five games has one carry for 11 yards and one kickoff return for 22 yards.
Tyler Varga, Yale, Colts, RB: Undrafted free agent has moved up to third-string. Limited stats on offense but has returned a team leading six kickoffs for 151 yards. Has been inactive the last two games with a concussion.
Nick Williams, UConn, Falcons WR: Listed as fourth strong, has caught one pass in each of Atlanta’s five games for a total of 44 yards.
Blidi Wreh-Wilson, UConn, Titans, CB: Listed as second-string. Has appeared in all four games with four tackles and three passes defensed.
